153.content:
Your name was Nico Dore. You were short for your age with longish forest brown hair, moss green eyes and doll like features. A lot of people mistook you for a girl which you had become used to. Your parents were vastly wealthy though they never acted like it and raised you to be humble. They had sent you to some all boys boarding school so to get the best education money could buy. Only due to some clerical error somewhere in the process, you were mislabeled as a female and transferred to Berkly Transformation Academy. You did not realize the error until you had arrived at the school with your paperwork in hand. What made you more uncomfortable was that the school was heavily isolated in a deep forest out in the middle of nowhere. "Well, this is an interesting development." Wrinkling your nose at the paperwork, you said. You sighed. "I better get this straightened out right away."

You walked straight into the administrations office where you were seen by the head of administrations, Miss Carrol. She was a short but slender professionally dressed woman with long black hair and blue eyes. "I'm afraid there is an error in my transfer papers, ma'am." Politely, you said. "I'm really a boy." You offered your identification as proof of your claim. "Is there a way I can be transferred to an all boy school?"

Miss Carrol looked at your identification and the transfer papers before turning to you with a bemused look on her face. "This is certainly an awkward situation you found yourself in... Miss Dore." Smiling, she said. You blushed at her little joke but she turned from you to talk to the other members of the administrations staff before you could utter a word.

"At least they are looking into the matter." Sighing, you thought.

You saw some activity on the phones before a number of them shook their heads and Miss Carrol turned back to you. "I am sorry but there is nothing we can do for you." Serious, she said. "You are the last transfer student so the last ride out of here left after it dropped you off." She turned to her staff. "Also the all boy schools in the area are booked solid so I'm afraid you are stuck here with us girls."

You blushed deeply at that as you heard a number of giggles from the staff. "How am I going to fit in an all girls school?" Taken back, you demanded.

"Well, you certainly look the part." Bemused, Miss Carrol said. She then turned serious seeing you beginning to tear up. "Now, now, this school does welcome boys though it is rare. Just be yourself as everything will work out fine in the end."

Miss Carrol then handed you a number of papers with the school rules, a hall and classroom map, and a voucher to pick up your school uniforms before sending you to the school store. "This is not how I expected my new found freedom to feel like." Blushing, you muttered. "This is going to be an awkward year."

It did not take you long to find the school store though, upon walking in, you found...

15322.content:
You took a step back, uncertain. "But, I'm a..." You began.

Grace smiled. "Shy, huh?" Bemused, she said. "That's okay..."

You let out a high pitched yelp as you found yourself being lifted off the ground by nothing and pulled into the changing room. You gave a short shrill scream as your clothing literally pulled themselves off of you and a roll of measuring tape floated into the room. Unable to resist, you were quickly measured and a number of girls clothing flew into the room and forced themselves onto you. This included panties, a bra, and the school uniform consisting of a dark blue pleated skirt, ivory colored blouse, and dark blue sleeveless jacket with a pink ribbon bow tie. White knee high socks were added with mary-jane flats before you were released by the invisible force and the door to the changing room opened for you. By the time you found the courage to step out, you found Grace smiling at you, blushing slightly.

"I did not realize you were a boy." Grinning, she said. "How embarrassing." She giggled, making you blush more than you already were. "You are really cute for a boy. Don't be surprised if your life changes soon after your first class."

"What do you mean?" Wincing, you asked.

Grace looked at you surprised. "You don't know?"

"Know what?" Confused, you asked. "I was sent here due to a clerical error and I have to stay because all of the boy boarding schools are booked."

Grace giggled further, making you worry. "Well, the girls here tend to try to get cute boys like yourself to 'come out of their shell'." Cryptically, she said. "Don't be too surprised if they try to make you more feminine."

You rolled your eyes at that as Grace then handed you a few more sets of uniforms and the school swimsuit, made for girls of course. Once you had everything you needed, you followed the map you got from administrations to your dorm. It was rather spacious with room for four students. "Cozy little place." Smiling slightly, you said. "I hope my dorm mates don't mind sharing a space with a boy."

You found the bed with your name on a plaque hanging from the headboard and began to unpack. As you did, you paused upon seeing a shadow and looked up to find your dorm mates...

1532244.content:
You found yourself looking up at four girls, all from whom you sensed powerful energy. Though you did not understand why. "Do you feel that radiating from him, Adey?" Curious, the first girl asked. "How strange..."

"I feel it, Lena." Raising an eyebrow, the second girl said She turned to the third girl. "What do you make of it, Lila?"

You turned from Adey to Lena, wondering what they were talking about. Both were slender with brown hair and green eyes only Adey was rather tall while Lena was rather short, you guessed they were sisters.

"He's a familiar." Serious, the third girl, Lila said. "Only by his obviously confused expression, he has no clue." She shook her head, a bemused look forming upon her face. "I am guessing he is a first born, Zeva. What are we to do with him?"

"I concur." Softly, the fourth girl said. "Other covens in the school are bound to sense this the moment they lay eyes on him." She sighed at your increasing uneasy expression. "Worse, he is an unknown. The laws are very clear on that point."

You turned between Lila and Zeva, feeling anxious. You wanted to run but something was holding you where you sat. Lila was about your height with doll like features, blond hair and blue eyes. Zeva was slightly taller than you, muscular, with long black hair and blue eyes. It was unnerving how they all began to talk to each other about you as if you were not in the room...

"Um... What are you guys talking about?" Nervous, you squeaked.

The girls stopped talking among themselves and returned their focus on you. "Do you sense anything strange when near us?" Serious, Zeva asked.

"I kind of get the feeling you are all powerful." Wincing, you replied.

Zeva grunted. "What brings you to this school?"

"A clerical error." Frowning, you answered. "I was supposed to go to an all boys boarding school but i got sent here by mistake and all the boys schools are booked."

Zeva shook her head. "A clerical error may have brought you here but that's not why administrations kept you here." Darkly, she said. "You are a familiar."

"I'm a what?" Confused, you asked.

Lila sighed. "A familiar is usually a cat or a crow with unimaginable magical power." Serious, she explained. "These animals, although can never work magic, can grant some or all of it to a magical individual and or her coven to increase their power."

"For a familiar to be human is rare, for that human to be a boy is extremely rare." Jumping in, Zeva said. "You, Cire, are quite literally one in a billion."

"If anyone in administrations was a magic woman, they may already be plotting to take you under her wing." Wincing, Adey said. "I say we permanently transform him into a girl so no one can steal her magic."

"Why the rush, we can change him at any time." Softly, Lena argued. "We can all gain from a boost in our powers."

"It's too risky." Serious, Lila said. "Even now, I fear word of Cire's talent is spreading like wild fire among the other magic girls on campus."

The other girls turned to Zeva to be the tie breaker in their discussion, making you even more frightened and nervous. "Don't I get a say in this?"

"I'm afraid not." Firmly, Zeva said. "You have no clue what you are capable of and that can be dangerous. Worse, from what we have gathered, you are a first in your bloodline which means we have no way of knowing how powerful you truly are."

The girls then continued to talk for what seemed like hours before they apparently came to an agreement and turned to you. "Welcome to our coven, Cire." Smiling, Zeva said. "We are proud to have you among us as..."

"This made you the extremely rare familiar we told you about." Calmly, Lila said. "A highly valuable prize to any coven."

"Only we changed you into a girl so you can keep all of your magic." Serious, Zeva said. "However, that is a double edged sword."

"It helps but it hurts too." Wincing, you said. "Is it because of this magic I was born with you told me about?"

Adey nodded. "Being a girl now, you have access to that magic, just as we do." Firmly but kindly, she said. "However, you have that magic all at once instead of it steadily growing over time."

"Worse, on top of that, you have to deal with being a teenage girl all at once." Serious, Zeva said. "Hormones, social issues and so on."

"Don't worry though." Smiling, Adey said. "You are not the first boy turned girl here and we will teach you how to control your magic."

Just as you entered the school store, a teenage girl in a pointed black hat and robes ran out without looking and plowed right into you! Being small for your age, you were knocked off your feet. Worse, the girl was carrying some cloth bag filled with a fine pink powder and a good amount of it blew directly into your face! You coughed, breathing most of it in before a dainty hand reached down to help you up.

"My apologies, miss." Wincing, the girl said. "I'm a little late for my potions club meeting."

"It- It's okay." Blushing slightly, you said. "No harm, not foul." You blushed further, noticing your voice was a few octaves higher. You guessed it was your nerves.

The girl giggled slightly, giving you a knowledgeable smile. "My name is Elle Hickory." Bemused, she said. "You might want to talk to me later on." She handed you a card. "You can find me in the potions club."

With that, she hurried off. Confused, you continued to walk into the school store only to find yourself struggling to keep your balance. This confused you at first but after seeing the teenage girl running the school store give you the same knowledgeable smile, you became worried. "What was that powder that hit me just now?"

"That was a gender changing powder, used to change a boy into a girl." Bemused, the girl replied. "I take it you were not expecting this."

"I was sent here by clerical error." Wincing, you said.

The girl giggled. "Well, at least you won't have any trouble fitting in now that you are one of the girls." Smiling, she said. "You see the gender changing effects of that powder does not wear off..."
